1.text: I beseech you therefore, brothers, by the mercies of God, that you present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, which is your reasonable service.

2.text: And be not conformed to this world: but be you transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what is that good, and acceptable, and perfect, will of God.

3.text: For I say, through the grace given to me, to every man that is among you, not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think; but to think soberly, according as God has dealt to every man the measure of faith.

4.text: For as we have many members in one body, and all members have not the same office:

5.text: So we, being many, are one body in Christ, and every one members one of another.

6.text: Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us, whether prophecy, let us prophesy according to the proportion of faith;

7.text: Or ministry, let us wait on our ministering: or he that teaches, on teaching;

8.text: Or he that exhorts, on exhortation: he that gives, let him do it with simplicity; he that rules, with diligence; he that shows mercy, with cheerfulness.

9.text: Let love be without dissimulation. Abhor that which is evil; hold to that which is good.

10.text: Be kindly affectionate one to another with brotherly love; in honor preferring one another;

11.text: Not slothful in business; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;

12.text: Rejoicing in hope; patient in tribulation; continuing instant in prayer;

13.text: Distributing to the necessity of saints; given to hospitality.

14.text: Bless them which persecute you: bless, and curse not.

15.text: Rejoice with them that do rejoice, and weep with them that weep.

16.text: Be of the same mind one toward another. Mind not high things, but condescend to men of low estate. Be not wise in your own conceits.

17.text: Recompense to no man evil for evil. Provide things honest in the sight of all men.

18.text: If it be possible, as much as lies in you, live peaceably with all men.

19.text: Dearly beloved, avenge not yourselves, but rather give place to wrath: for it is written, Vengeance is mine; I will repay, said the Lord.

20.text: Therefore if your enemy hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give him drink: for in so doing you shall heap coals of fire on his head.

21.text: Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.
